description: The Many Springs trail is suitable for the absolute beginner or families with strollers. This is a 1.8 km loop around a spring fed lake. This trail is known for its abundance in spectacular flowers. This is also an area known for its diversity birds.
directions: Leave Canmore heading east 27 km on highway #1. Or leave Calgary heading west on highway #1, 5 kilometers after the highway #40 intersection. At exit #114 head north to Seebe/Exshaw. At this point you will be on highway 1X. The Bow valley provincial park entrance is to the west of the highway. The trail head is located at the Many Springs Parking Lot which is located about 2 km west following the paved road that goes through the park.
title: Many Springs Trail
